title: Great Limber Walks

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Great Limber Village Hall
images.caption: Great Limber Village Hall. Looking east-southeast across the pond on Church Lane

images.title: St Peter's church, Great Limber by J.Hannan-Briggs, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Peter's church, Great Limber. The church is Grade I listed with parts dating from the 13th century.

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Pelham Family Mausoleum, Great Limber
images.caption: Pelham Family Mausoleum on the Brocklesby Estate. Dedicated to the memory of Sophia, wife of C A Pelham, who died on the 25th January 1786 aged 33.

images.title: David Wright / Mausoleum Woods
images.caption: Mausoleum Woods. Mausoleum Woods form part of Brocklesby Park. This woodland area is located just north of the settelement. N.B as of 2023 the woods are now closed to the public.

images.title: A wood at Limber Hill by Ian S, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A wood at Limber Hill

images.title: Ian Paterson / Footpath to Irby Dales Wood
images.caption: Footpath to Irby Dales Wood

images.title: Grove Wold Cottages by Jonathan Thacker, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Grove Wold Cottages

description: This historic Lincolnshire based village is surrounded by some attractive countryside and woodland. The interesting settlement also includes a noteworthy 13th century church and the Brocklesby Estate where there is a yearly country fair in June. This fairly flat walk from the village follows country lanes and footpaths south east to visit the neighbouring village of Irby Upon Humber. On the way there's some lovely country views with a woodland section through Dales Wood near the end. To extend the walk you could pick up the Wanderlust Way south of Irby. The popular circular walk explores the countryside of the Lincolnshire Wolds AONB.
